about.description:
mvlearn is a python package for multi-view machine learning. It offers
a comprehensive, tested, and well-documented collection of multi-view
learning tools, enabling anyone to readily access and apply such
methods to their data.
about.summary: A python package for multi-view machine learning

name: mvlearn

new_version_errors.0.2.1:
The recipe did not change in the version migration, a URL did not hash, or there is jinja2 syntax the bot cannot handle!

Please check the URLs in your recipe with version '0.2.1' to make sure they exist!

We also found the following errors:

 - could not hash URL template 'https://github.com/neurodata/mvlearn/releases/download/{{ version }}-torch/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz'

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "mvlearn" %}
{% set version = "0.2.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/neurodata/mvlearn/releases/download/{{ version }}-torch/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 4c9d79cb5fedd4afa9240462b8e66e02a583d3719535e1759861d2474d002b68

build:
  noarch: python
  number: 0
  script: 
    "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv"

requirements:
  host:
    - python >=3.6
    - pip
  run:
    - python >=3.6
    - graspy >=0.1.1
    - matplotlib-base >=3.0.0
    - numpy >=1.17.0
    - pandas >=0.25.0
    - scikit-learn >=0.19.1
    - scipy >=1.1.0
    - seaborn >=0.9.0
    - pytorch >=1.1.0
    - tqdm
    - joblib >=0.11

test:
  imports:
    - mvlearn
    - mvlearn.factorization
    - mvlearn.cluster
    - mvlearn.cotraining
    - mvlearn.construct
    - mvlearn.datasets
    - mvlearn.embed
    - mvlearn.plotting
    - mvlearn.utils

about:
  home: https://mvlearn.neurodata.io/
  license: Apache-2.0
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: 'A python package for multi-view machine learning'
  description: |
    mvlearn is a python package for multi-view machine learning. It offers
    a comprehensive, tested, and well-documented collection of multi-view
    learning tools, enabling anyone to readily access and apply such
    methods to their data.
  doc_url: https://mvlearn.neurodata.io/
  dev_url: https://github.com/neurodata/mvlearn

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - gmischl1
    - rflperry
